Package gui_code

Class ViewIslands

java.lang.Object
gui_code.ViewIslands
public class ViewIslands
extends java.lang.Object
The window for looking at all islands currently in the game As well as their shops and routes
Author:
nzoli

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Island currentIsland
    The island we are currently at/sailing from
    private descriptionMaker describer
    A descriptionMaker Instance that will output strings for describing our routes A toString method would have been way too messy, as part of the description is dependent on ship details
    private javax.swing.JFrame frame
    The window being rendered/displayed part of Window Builder
    private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> islandNames
    The names of the islands, in a constant order.
    private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​Island> islands
    A The selection of islands.
    private UiManager manager
    The UiManager instance responsible for multi-window cooperation
    private Ship ship
    The ship the player is sailing.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ViewIslands()
    Create the application.
    ViewIslands​(UiManager incomingManager)
    Modified constructor to be used in the manager

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void closeWindow()
    closes the window
    void goBack()
    Tells the manager to go back to the island window
    private void initialize()
    Initialize the contents of the frame.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Launch the application.
    private void makeIslandNames()
    Helper function to ensure the island names always have the same order.
    private java.lang.String routeModeller​(Island destination)
    Helper function for the update routes button Externalized like this because it will be useful for displaying island info in other windows copied and modified from SelectSail

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • frame

      private javax.swing.JFrame frame
      The window being rendered/displayed part of Window Builder

    • manager

      private UiManager manager
      The UiManager instance responsible for multi-window cooperation

    • islands

      private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​Island> islands
      A The selection of islands. Due it being a hashtable, with no order, an ArrayList must be made as well to ensure order.

    • islandNames

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> islandNames
      The names of the islands, in a constant order.

    • describer

      private descriptionMaker describer
      A descriptionMaker Instance that will output strings for describing our routes A toString method would have been way too messy, as part of the description is dependent on ship details

    • currentIsland

      private Island currentIsland
      The island we are currently at/sailing from

    • ship

      private Ship ship
      The ship the player is sailing. Relevant for speed display

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewIslands

      public ViewIslands()
      Create the application.

    • ViewIslands

      public ViewIslands​(UiManager incomingManager)
      Modified constructor to be used in the manager
      Parameters:
      incomingManager - The UiManager instance that will be managing this window

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Launch the application.
      Parameters:
      args - Stores the Java command line arguments

    • makeIslandNames

      private void makeIslandNames()
      Helper function to ensure the island names always have the same order.

    • closeWindow

      public void closeWindow()
      closes the window

    • goBack

      public void goBack()
      Tells the manager to go back to the island window

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initialize the contents of the frame.

    • routeModeller

      private java.lang.String routeModeller​(Island destination)
      Helper function for the update routes button Externalized like this because it will be useful for displaying island info in other windows copied and modified from SelectSail
      Parameters:
      destination - The Island that the player wants to view routes to
      Returns:
      A DefaultListModel of strings describing the routes
